translation: przylegać, sąsiadować [formal; to be very near, next to, or touching]
sentence: The stables adjoin the west wing of the house.

translation: mrowisko [a pile of soil created by ants when they are making their nests underground]
sentence: Ants were collected from anthills or plants to which they were attached.

translation: przeciwstawny, sprzeczny [formal; exactly the opposite of someone or something or of each other]
sentence: The idea that science is antithetical to the arts is wrong.

translation: rzemieślnik [old-fashioned; a person who does skilled work, making things with their hands]
sentence: You will learn how eighteenth-century artisans did their work.

translation: dezorientować, oszołamiać [to confuse someone]
sentence: The instructions completely bewildered me.

translation: przechwalać się [to talk with too much pride about something that you have or can do]
sentence: I don't want to boast, but I can actually speak six languages.

translation: opiekać [to cook something under a very hot surface in a cooker]
sentence: I'll broil the bacon rather than fry it.

translation: szorstki, obcesowy [quick and rude in manner or speech; using very few words and sounding rude]
sentence: As the president’s chief of staff, he offended many with his brusque manner.

translation: dłuto [a tool with a long metal blade that has a sharp edge for cutting wood, stone, etc.]
sentence: The tools employed are chisel, gouge and mallet.

translation: stracić urok, przesycać [to become annoying or too much, after seeming pleasant or enjoyable at first]
sentence: After a while, his prose style starts to cloy. She has a charm and freshness that never cloys.

translation: jedność, spójność [(of objects) the state of sticking together, or (of people) being in close agreement and working well together]
sentence: The team just seems to lack cohesion.

translation: grzebień [a strip of plastic, wood, or metal with a row of long, narrow parts along one side, which is used to arrange or hold the hair]
sentence: Combs have been used from ancient times by women to hold and fix their hair.

translation: zakaźny, zaraźliwy [(of a disease) able to be caught by touching someone with the disease or something the person has touched or worn, or (of a person) having this type of disease]
sentence: The infection is highly contagious, so don't let anyone else use your towel.

translation: dziedziniec [an area of flat ground outside that is partly or completely surrounded by the walls of a building]
sentence: Entrance to the apartment building is through a central courtyard.

translation: interesować się, parać się [to take a slight and not very serious interest in a subject, or try a particular activity for a short period]
sentence: He first dabbled in politics when he was at law school. She dabbled with drugs at university.

translation: potępienie [the act of sending someone to hell or the state of being in hell]
sentence: He believed that he would be condemned to eternal damnation for what he had done.

translation: zaniechać, odstąpić [to stop doing something, especially something that someone else does not want you to do]
sentence: The soldiers have been ordered to desist from firing their guns.

translation: mylić się, błądzić [formal; to make a mistake or to do something wrong]
sentence: He erred in agreeing to her appointment to the position.

translation: filc [a soft, thick cloth that is made from wool, hair, or fur that has been pressed together]
sentence: One would not be served in a shop unless one wore a felt hat.

translation: paproć [a green plant with long stems, leaves like feathers, and no flowers]
sentence: When I saw the fern, I was reminded of primitive plants that I saw in a history video.

translation: chłostać [to hit someone repeatedly as a punishment with something such as a stick]
sentence: Soldiers used to be flogged for disobedience.

translation: polana [literary; a small area of grass without trees in a forest]
sentence: There were several small woodland glades dominated by various grasses.

translation: paść się [(of cows, sheep, etc.) to eat grass that is growing in a field]
sentence: Cattle grazed in the meadow.

translation: zatoka [a very large area of sea surrounded on three sides by a coast]
sentence: The Gulf of Mexico is a geographic area and a body of water that forms the so-called third coast of the contiguous United States.

translation: mgiełka, opary [something such as heat or smoke in the air that makes it less clear, so that it is difficult to see well]
sentence: I saw her through a haze of cigarette smoke.

translation: stado [a large group of animals of the same type that live and feed together]
sentence: She pushed her way through a herd of lunchtime drinkers.

translation: niniejszym [formal; with these words or with this action]
sentence: I hereby pronounce you man and wife.

translation: klepsydra [a glass container holding sand that takes exactly an hour to pass through a small opening between the top and bottom sections]
sentence: She tipped the hourglass, and black sand began to spill.

translation: ogromnie, niezmiernie [extremely]
sentence: He was immensely popular in his day.

translation: nakaz/zakaz sądowy [an official order given by a law court, usually to stop someone from doing something]
sentence: The court has issued an injunction to prevent the airline from increasing its prices.

translation: wrodzony [(of a quality) which you are born with, or which is present naturally]
sentence: Her dance expresses the innate beauty of the human spirit.

translation: pech, fatum [bad luck, or a person or thing that is believed to bring bad luck]
sentence: There's a jinx on this computer – it's crashed three times this morning!

translation: sprośny [(esp. of behavior or speech) sexual in an obvious and socially unacceptable way]
sentence: Ignore him - he's being lewd.

translation: szarańcza [a large insect found in hot areas that flies in large groups and destroys plants and crops]
sentence: Last year's rain shortages and locust invasion severely affected agricultural production and grasslands reserved for cattle.

translation: drewniany młotek [a tool like a hammer with a large, flat end made of wood or rubber]
sentence: Lay it on a workbench and sharply smack it with a mallet.

translation: piżmo [a substance with a strong sweet smell, used in making perfumes]
sentence: Her chamber smelled of jasmine, her scrubbed body of flower musk.

translation: usunąć, wyprzeć [to force someone to leave a position of power, job, place, or competition]
sentence: Police are trying to oust drug dealers from the cityr.

translation: dziwaczny, obcy [disapproving; strange and unusual and difficult to accept or like]
sentence: As the show progressed, it got ever more outlandish.

translation: pionek [any one of the eight least valuable pieces in the game of chess]
sentence: The refugees are pawns in an international political dispute.

translation: przedostatni [formal; second from the last]
sentence: It's the penultimate episode of the series tonight.

translation: pobożny [strongly believing in religion, and living in a way that shows this belief]
sentence: She is a pious follower of the faith, never missing her prayers.

translation: nękać, prześladować [to cause worry, pain, or difficulty to someone or something over a period of time]
sentence: Financial problems have been plaguing their new business partners.

translation: spadać gwałtownie, zanurzyć [to (cause someone or something to) move or fall suddenly and often a long way forward, down, or into something]
sentence: We ran down to the beach and plunged into the sea.

translation: okręg, dystrykt [a division of a city or a town, especially an area protected by a particular unit of the police or a division used for voting purposes]
sentence: The voter turnout in most precincts is expected to be high.

translation: wydłużać, przedłużać [to make something last a longer time]
sentence: We were having such a good time that we decided to prolong our stay by another week.

translation: wystawać, sterczeć [to stick out from or through something]
sentence: A rotting branch protruded from the swamp like a ghostly arm.

translation: cięty żart [a quick, intelligent, and often amusing remark]
sentence: It was Oscar Wilde who made the famous quip about life mimicking art.

translation: konsekwencje [the possible result of a decision or action]
sentence: Have you considered all the ramifications of changing careers at this stage of your life?

translation: grzechotnik [a poisonous snake found in southern parts of the US that, when annoyed, produces a loud noise by shaking its tail]
sentence: A huge rattlesnake lay coiled on the blanket.

translation: odnawiać, remontować [to make a building look new again by doing work such as painting, repairing, and cleaning]
sentence: The developers refurbished the house inside and out.

translation: rozbrzmiewać [(of a sound) to be repeated several times as it is reflected off different surfaces]
sentence: Her voice reverberated around the canyon walls.

translation: broić, hasać [to play in a rough, excited, and noisy way]
sentence: Two fox cubs romped playfully on the riverbank.

translation: ocalić [to try to make a bad situation better; to save goods from damage or destruction, especially from a ship that has sunk or been damaged or a building that has been damaged by fire or a flood]
sentence: After the fire, there wasn't much furniture left worth salvaging.

translation: sok rośliny [the liquid that carries food to all parts of a plant]
sentence: Maple syrup is obtained from the sap of the sugar maple tree.

translation: pogarda, lekceważenie [a very strong feeling of no respect for someone or something that you think is stupid or has no value]
sentence: She has nothing but scorn for the new generation of politicians.

translation: muł, osad [sand or soil that is carried along by flowing water and then dropped, especially at a bend in a river or at a river's opening]
sentence: Considerable deposits of mud, silt and sand are accumulating in many of the estuaries.

translation: sofistyka [formal; the use of intelligent arguments to persuade people that something is true when it is really false]
sentence: Convincing myself that I had gained in some way from my loss was just pure sophistry.

translation: zataczać się, chwiać się na nogach [to walk or move with difficulty as if you are going to fall]
sentence: After he was attacked, he managed to stagger to the phone and call for help.

translation: udusić [to kill someone by pressing their throat so that they cannot breathe]
sentence: She had been strangled with her own scarf and her body dumped in the woods.

translation: ssanie [the force that pulls something into a container or space by removing air]
sentence: Vacuum cleaners work by suction.

translation: cieniutki, słaby, niepewny [literary or formal; extremely thin and easily broken; so weak or uncertain that it hardly exists]
sentence: The police have only found a tenuous connection between the two robberies.

translation: główna ulica, arteria [formal; a main road for public use or a passage through somewhere]
sentence: The property was located at the intersection of two busy thoroughfares.

translation: wieści [old-fashioned or humorous; news]
sentence: I am the bearer of good tidings.

translation: męka, udręka [literary or humorous; great trouble or suffering]
sentence: Paul had known tribulation, he had known distress, he had known persecution.

translation: brnąć, iść z trudem [to walk slowly with a lot of effort, especially over a difficult surface or while carrying something heavy]
sentence: I'd had to trudge through the snow.

translation: pod stopami [under your feet; on the ground where you are walking]
sentence: The grass was cool and pleasant underfoot. I was nearly trampled underfoot by the crowd of people rushing for the door.

translation: zaniedbany, rozczochrany [disapproving; untidy; not cared for]
sentence: He needed a shave and his hair was unkempt.

translation: szaty liturgiczne [the special clothes worn by priests during church ceremonies]
sentence: His meals were always ready, his clothes clean and pressed, and his vestments for the Sunday service were immaculate.

translation: salwa, seria [a lot of bullets, stones, etc. that are fired or thrown at the same time; a lot of similar things that are said or produced, or that happen, quickly one after the other]
sentence: Police fired a volley over the heads of the crowd. I'm afraid my proposal was met with a volley of criticisms.

translation: zimowy, chłodny [typical of winter’s cold, windy, and snowy weather; literary; unfriendly and disapproving]
sentence: Wintry conditions are making roads hazardous for drivers. She gave a wintry smile.
